sentences.en: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
sentences.cn: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

sentences.en: Harbage continues more specifically to define Shakespeare's ethical outlook.
sentences.cn: 哈比奇接着更具体地阐述了莎士比亚的道德观.

sentences.en: He incorrectly used the product of velocity and weight to define momentum.
sentences.cn: 他错误地将动量定义为速度与重量的乘积.

sentences.en: He was asked to define his concept of cool.
sentences.cn: 他被要求说明自己关于“酷”的定义。

sentences.en: I’ll now try to define the term ‘popular culture’.
sentences.cn: 我现在来试试给 “通俗文化” 这个词下定义。

sentences.en: In everyday life we use this property to define straightness.
sentences.cn: 在日常生活中我们运用这一特点来解释直线性.

sentences.en: It is difficult to define the detection limits obtained by chelation - solvent extraction.
sentences.cn: 确定螯合 -- 溶剂萃取法所得到的检测限颇为困难.

sentences.en: It's hard to define exactly what has changed.
sentences.cn: 很难解释清楚到底发生了什么变化.

sentences.en: Our goals were to define the information - related management practices of today's producers.
sentences.cn: 我们的目标是为了弄清今天生产者的与信息有关的管理措施.
请准确地解释这些字的意义.

sentences.en: Please listen while I define your duties.
sentences.cn: 在我规定你的职责时,请仔细听好.

sentences.en: Secondly it is necessary to define the applied load.
sentences.cn: 其次,需要确定所作用的载荷.

sentences.en: the ability to define clients’ needs
The duties of the post are difficult to define.
sentences.cn: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

sentences.en: The perception of pain is still complex and remains difficult to define.
sentences.cn: 疼痛的感知至今仍认为很复杂,难以解释.

sentences.en: The purpose was to define the constitutional position.
sentences.cn: 目的是确立议会的宪法性地位.

sentences.en: We were unable to define what exactly was wrong with him.
sentences.cn: 我们说不清楚他到底哪里不对劲。

sentences.en: When people are asked "What is intelligence?" they tend to reply: "I don't know how to define it, but I can certainly recognize it when I see it."
sentences.cn: 当被问及“智力是什么”的时候，人们往往会回答说：“我不知道该如何定义它，但我见到了肯定就能认得出。”

sentences.en: You can define the excessive speed of your motor - car by a speedometer.
sentences.cn: 你可以用速测表来确定摩托车已经超速.

words.tran_cn: 可下定义的；可确定的；可限定的
有定义的，确定的；清晰的，轮廓分明的
最典型的；起决定性作用的
决定性的；最后的；限定的
清楚地，当然；明确地，肯定地
确定性，定指；明确；清晰度；梅性
定义；[物] 清晰度；解说
使明确；给...下定义；使...的轮廓分明（define的过去分词）
规定（define的ing形式）；给…下定义；表明特征

trans.tran_cn: 阐明，限定，给…下定义，描出…的界线
trans.tran_en: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things
to explain exactly the meaning of a particular word or idea
